Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with immigration regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration Officer erred in law by failing to consider the correct test for humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Application_Facts: Ms. Jung had no family ties in Canada, limited financial stability, and her claimed risk of abuse was considered comparable to general population risks in Korea
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review denied; no question certified
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failed to meet criteria for humanitarian and compassionate considerations
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of abuse in Korea, lack of support network
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship test
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Family ties, financial stability, risk level in country of origin
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Proper application of legal test in H&C assessment
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Risk of abuse not found to be beyond general societal conditions in Korea
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Nature and severity of alleged abuse, integration in Canada
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Alleged harm not found to be unusual or disproportionate
Crimes.Cause_Description: Denial of second H&C application led to judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer assessed submitted documents and context
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; compliance with procedural fairness
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of corroborative evidence for abuse claim
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Overstay noted but central issue was H&C refusal
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer weighed personal and public interest factors
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No unusual or disproportionate hardship established
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Generalized risk does not meet H&C threshold

Crimes.Violation_Type: Remaining in Canada beyond authorized period
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration Officer erred in law by failing to consider the correct test for humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Application_Facts: Ms. Jung overstayed her visa, made two H&C applications, claimed fear of abuse; insufficient hardship and ties to Canada found
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review denied; no question of general importance certified
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada after visa expiration
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of abuse in Korea, desire to remain in Canada
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship test
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Length of overstay, attempts to regularize status, risk upon return
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Correct legal test applied in H&C assessment
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Affidavits, previous application records, country information
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds due to overstay and personal circumstances
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Duration of stay, compliance history, personal vulnerabilities
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of proof of exceptional circumstances justifying exemption
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk not found to exceed normal conditions in Korea
Crimes.Cause_Description: Rejection of second H&C application following visa overstay
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 183 of IRPA (failure to leave by end of authorized stay)
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court's supervisory role over immigration decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Balanced equities of staying vs. returning
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No basis to find decision unreasonable or legally flawed
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Generalized claims insufficient for H&C relief
